contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Iowarivermap.png|right|200px|thumb|Map showing the Cedar (to the right) and Iowa (to the left) rivers.]] [[Image:Iowa River.jpg|thumb|300px|The Iowa River upstream of [[Marshalltown, Iowa]]]] The '''Iowa River''' is a [[tributary]] of the [[Mississippi River]] in the state of [[Iowa]] in the [[United States]]. It is about {{convert|323|mi}} long<ref name=NHD>U.S. Geological Survey. National Hydrography Dataset high-resolution flowline data. [http://viewer.nationalmap.gov/viewer/ The National Map], accessed May 13, 2011</ref> and is open to small river craft to [[Iowa City, Iowa|Iowa City]], about {{convert|65|mi}} from its mouth. Its major tributary is the [[Cedar River (Iowa River)|Cedar River]]. It rises in two branches, the West Branch and East Branch, both of which have their [[headwaters]] in [[Hancock County, Iowa|Hancock County]], each about {{convert|38|mi}} long and which join in [[Belmond, Iowa|Belmond]].<ref name=NHD/> The Iowa then proceeds roughly in a southeast direction, passing through the city of [[Iowa Falls, Iowa|Iowa Falls]], through a scenic valley to [[Steamboat Rock, Iowa|Steamboat Rock]], then through the cities of [[Eldora, Iowa|Eldora]], [[Marshalltown, Iowa|Marshalltown]], [[Tama, Iowa|Tama]], and [[Marengo, Iowa|Marengo]], and through the [[Amana Colonies]] in [[Iowa County, Iowa|Iowa County]]. In [[Johnson County, Iowa|Johnson County]], it becomes impounded by the Coralville Dam in the [[Coralville Lake|Coralville Reservoir]], which turns southward to the spillway. The river runs generally south and passes through [[Iowa City, Iowa|Iowa City]] and the [[University of Iowa]] campus. A [[lowhead dam]] at Burlington Street in Iowa City is the last dam before the river's confluence with the Mississippi. South of Iowa City, it is joined by the [[English River (Iowa)|English River]], and then in [[Louisa County, Iowa|Louisa County]] it is joined by the [[Cedar River (Iowa River)|Cedar River]] to flow into the Mississippi. The Iowa River is noted for recreational and commercial fishing. Game fish include [[largemouth bass|largemouth]] and [[smallmouth bass]], [[walleye]], [[northern pike]], [[channel catfish|channel]] and [[flathead catfish]], [[crappie]] and other [[panfish]]. The Coralville Reservoir is [[commercial fishing|commercially fished]] for [[carp]] and [[ictiobus|buffalo fish]]. [[Pine Lake State Park]] is located on the Iowa River at [[Eldora, Iowa|Eldora]]. ==Floods== The Iowa can flood, notably in the [[June 2008 Midwest floods]], and the [[Great Flood of 1993]]. The Cedar and its tributaries, including the [[Shell Rock River]], can contribute to flooding events. ==See also== *[[Homer D. Calkins]] *[[List of Iowa rivers]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Collier's Poster}} *{{Commons category-inline}} *{{gnis|457834|Iowa River}} {{coord|41|9|38|N|91|1|26|W|display=title}} [[Category:Rivers of Iowa]] [[Category:Tributaries of the Mississippi River]] [[Category:Geography of Hancock County, Iowa]] [[Category:Geography of Iowa County, Iowa]] [[Category:Geography of Johnson County, Iowa]] [[Category:Geography of Hardin County, Iowa]] [[Category:Geography of Marshall County, Iowa]] [[Category:Geography of Tama County, Iowa]]
